Sultan Nazrin: Maintain national peace for the future's sake - Nation  The Star Online

KUALA KANGSAR: National harmony is being jeopardised due to political competition, warns Sultan Nazrin Muizzuddin Shah.

KUALA LUMPUR: The Sultan of Perak, Sultan Nazrin Shah, today emphasised the importance of having courageous and visionary leadership, saying it is ...

item.title: Problems of Muslim ummah due to leaders with no integrity - Sultan Nazrin's Maulidur Rasul speech - Nation - The Star Online
item.description:
Problems of Muslim ummah due to leaders with no integrity - Sultan Nazrin's Maulidur Rasul speech - Nation  The Star Online

PUTRAJAYA: Many of the problems faced by Muslims currently are caused by a lack of integrity among those entrusted with power, said Deputy Yang di-Pertuan ...

Sultan Nazrin calls for dynamic leadership - Nation  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: Dynamic leadership is needed for the country to keep pace in the face of a fast-changing world, says Sultan of Perak Sultan Nazrin ...

item.description:
Sultan Nazrin: Courageous, visionary leadership needed now more than ever - Nation  The Star Online

item.title: Malays caught in race to embarrass one another - Sultan Nazrin - Malaysiakini
item.description:
Malaysiakini

The Malays appear to be caught in a race to embarrass one another and are obsessed with the blame game which only reflects poorly on themselves, said Deputy Yang di-Pertuan Agong Sultan Nazrin Muizzuddin Shah. He said the nation’s political culture now had created a new obsession, that is of a racist nature and promoting a thinking that prioritise loyalty to a group rather than accepting the importance of the truth, and influencing minds to give more importance to group rather than the survival of the ummah ((Muslim) in general. Sultan Nazrin said the Malays now appeared to be increasingly ...

item.title: Malay blame game must end - The Star Online
item.description:
Malay blame game must end  The Star Online

MELAKA: The Malays appear to be caught up with embarrassing one another and obsessed with the blame game, says Deputy Yang di-Pertuan Agong Sultan Nazrin Muizzuddin Shah. Sultan Nazrin said the nation’s political culture had created a new obsession; that one of a racist nature, which prioritised loyalty to a group than accepting the truth. Sultan Nazrin said the Malays now appeared to be weak because they had lost the spirit of ukhuwah (brotherhood). They were weak in character and prefereed to pursue materialistic gains and were power crazy. “Islam united the Malays by building a solid bro...

item.title: Sultan Nazrin: A country must always uphold the rule of law - The Star Online
item.description:
Sultan Nazrin: A country must always uphold the rule of law  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: The credibility and confidence of the people in a country’s administration depend on the justice system, said Perak Ruler Sultan Nazrin Muizzuddin Shah (pix). He said a country must uphold the rule of law to ensure that justice is preserved at all times. "Justice and the people’s perception of how it is done can influence the stability of a country. Justice must not only be done, it must also be seen to be done,” he said at the 22nd Convocation for the Certificate in Legal Practice (CLP) Thursday. Sultan Nazrin said the public - even those without legal training - can see whe...

item.title: Sultan Nazrin: We need honest leaders - The Star Online
item.description:
Sultan Nazrin: We need honest leaders  The Star Online

PUTRAJAYA: Leaders who lack integrity will cause suffering for the people, says Deputy Yang di-Pertuan Agong Sultan Nazrin Muizzuddin Shah. When those entrusted with power have no integrity, they rush to accumulate wealth through dishonourable and dubious means, he said. “What also happens is a power struggle because power is seen as a channel or conduit to build wealth for themselves, their families and cronies,” Sultan Nazrin said in his address at the national-level Mau­lidur Rasul celebration here to mark the Prophet Muhammad’s birthday. He added that when leaders were always aware of t...

item.title: Sultan Nazrin: Varsities need to produce grads for jobs of the future - Malaysiakini
item.description:
Sultan Nazrin: Varsities need to produce grads for jobs of the future  Malaysiakini

Universities face the challenge of producing graduates for jobs which may not exist presently and offer an education that is synonymous with the world of the 'digital generation.' Sultan Nazrin Shah of Perak said to produce digital-minded students, the universities need to adapt to environmental changes and create a paradigm shift to become an active member of the digital ecosystem. "Universities must produce students who are resilient to cope with changes in technology that will create new jobs and may do away with existing jobs. "Employers and universities need to collaborate to identify ...

item.title: Ensure new technology will benefit all, says Perak Sultan - The Star Online
item.description:
Ensure new technology will benefit all, says Perak Sultan  The Star Online

KAMPAR: Sultan of Perak Sultan Nazrin Muizzuddin Shah has called for sufficient policy-making, regulation and education in the fields of science, technology, engineering and mathematics (STEM) to ensure new technologies are used for the greater good instead of instigating more inequality among the people. The Sultan said this was because the costs and benefits of technological changes were unlikely to be evenly distributed, and this could contribute to worsening inequality. He said scientists should play an important role in policy development and regulation of scientific and technological ...

item.title: Patriotism on parade - The Star Online
item.description:
Patriotism on parade  The Star Online

IT WAS a sight to behold as thousands of Perakians from all walks of life flocked to Jalan Panglima Bukit Gantang Wahab for the state-level National Day celebration. The road in front of the Ipoh City Hall quickly filled up, as people took their spots at the stands and along the streets to get the best possible view of the parade. As the entourage of royal guards escorting the Sultan of Perak Sultan Nazrin Muizzuddin Shah and Raja Permaisuri Perak Tuanku Zara Salim as well as other royal dignitaries arrived at the parade grounds around 8.20am, the crowd started waving the mini Jalur Gemilan...

item.title: Six outstanding individuals receive prestigious Merdeka Awards - The Star Online
item.description:
Six outstanding individuals receive prestigious Merdeka Awards  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: Six distinguished individuals who made outstanding and lasting contributions to the nation and the people of Malaysia were recipients of the prestigious 2017 Merdeka Awards here Monday night. All six recipients were selected from five categories, namely Education and Community; Environment; Health, Science and Technology; Outstanding Scholastic Achievement and Outstanding Contribution to the People of Malaysia. The awards were presented by the Sultan of Perak, Sultan Nazrin Shah. Also present at the ceremony was Raja Permaisuri Perak, Tuanku Zara Salim. The 2017 Merdeka Award ...

item.title: A year to remember - The Star Online
item.description:
A year to remember  The Star Online

THIS YEAR has certainly been a year to remember and to be proud of as both Perak and its capital Ipoh were recognised by popular international travel guide Lonely Planet, as one of the top 10 places in Asia for tourists to visit. Ipoh was listed at sixth spot as one of the best Asian destinations to visit while Perak was ranked ninth in the “Best in Travels 2017” list, which certainly gave a big boost to the state’s Visit Perak Year 2017 tourism drive. Besides this, the small town of Bagan Datoh was officially announced a full-fledged district by Prime Minister Datuk Seri Najib Razak, makin...

item.title: Big CNY do planned - The Star Online
item.description:
Big CNY do planned  The Star Online

A TROUPE of dancers from China will be performing at the state-level Chinese New Year celebration to be held at Arena Pangkor on Feb 3. Perak Non-Islamic Affairs Committee Chairman Datuk Dr Mah Hang Soon said several traditional dances, acrobatic and magic shows are in store during the event to be held from 5.30pm to 11pm. He said the 28-member troupe from the minority Dai, Wa and Jin Po clans in China will be perform in their respective traditional costumes. Among the performances planned for the evening include the “Horse and Lemur” dance, a wushu demonstration, and the “rattan bracelet” ...

item.title: Government not ruling out rise in price of imported rice - The Star Online
item.description:
Government not ruling out rise in price of imported rice  The Star Online

SITIAWAN: The Agriculture and Agro-Based Industry Ministry has not dismissed the possibility that the price of imported rice may rise in the future as it is not a controlled item. Minister Datuk Seri Ahmad Shabery Cheek (pic) said several factors could contribute to the rise in price, including the higher global price of rice and the depreciation of the ringgit. "However, this is mere speculation. The ceiling price of imported rice is not controlled but according to regulations, it cannot be sold at a lower price than local rice to protect the national rice industry. "Maybe, what the Rice W...

item.title: Perak Sultan: Malay community must not close eyes to misconduct - The Star Online
item.description:
Perak Sultan: Malay community must not close eyes to misconduct  The Star Online

IPOH: Perak Ruler Sultan Nazrin Muizzuddin Shah (pic) has reminded the Malay community not to take lightly the misconduct of some, who like termites can cause destruction to their own race. Sultan Nazrin said the Malays have only recently started to enjoy the fruits of success as compared to the bigger successes achieved by others. "Being materialistic and chasing after power were among the characteristics shown by some,” he said in his speech at the "Muzakarah Sultan Nazrin Muizzuddin Shah" held at a hotel here. "It is worrying that wealth in the hands of some Malays can possibly end in a ...

item.title: More Islamic capital products needed, says Sultan Nazrin - The Star Online
item.description:
More Islamic capital products needed, says Sultan Nazrin  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: There is a tremendous need to grow Islamic capital products to reduce dependence on the banking system and have greater financial stability, said Perak's Sultan Nazrin Shah. He said Islamic banking assets today account for about 80% of the global Islamic financial system, while Islamic capital products make up the balance 20%. "This means that other asset classes, such as sukuk, mutual and venture capital funds, private equity, insurance and microfinance and crowd funding need to be developed at a much faster rate," he said in his opening speech at the 14th Kuala Lumpur Islam...

item.title: Education on Naruhito’s mind - The Star Online
item.description:
Education on Naruhito’s mind  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: Education is one of the top agendas for Crown Prince of Japan Prince Naruhito in his first official visit to Malaysia. On the second day of his five-day trip, he visited two educational institutions, carrying the message that an exchange in education between Malaysia and Japan would greatly benefit both countries. Yesterday morning, Prince Naru­hito visited the Permata Pintar centre in Universiti Kebangsaan Malaysia, which runs a programme cultivating the innate intellectual and creative talent of nine to 17-year-olds. He was greeted by Datin Seri Rosmah Mansor, wife of Prime ...

item.title: Pak Lah releases autobiography - The Star Online
item.description:
Pak Lah releases autobiography  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: The Sultan of Perak, Sultan Nazrin Muizzuddin Shah, has paid tribute to former prime minister Tun Abdullah Ahmad Badawi for his efforts in enhancing integrity in this country. He noted that one of the first things that Abdullah did as prime minister was to set up the Malaysian Institute of Integrity in 2004 and sought to establish a body now called the Enforcement Agency Integrity Commission. "Tun Abdullah also sought to strengthen what was formerly known as the Anti-Corruption Agency by empowering it further to become the Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission," he said when la...

item.title: Be courageous, Perak Sultan tells judges - The Star Online
item.description:
Be courageous, Perak Sultan tells judges  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: The country needs courageous judges to instil confidence in the judicial system so that the institution remains respected, said Sultan Nazrin Muizzuddin Shah. Describing the current situation in the country as “challenging”, the Perak Ruler said it was crucial to ensure that the public has a high and clear regard of the judiciary. “We live in challenging times, in which our institutions sometimes seem to be under threat. “More than ever, we need courageous and fair-minded judges to instil confidence that the judicial system remains sacrosanct in guarding the rights, interests ...

item.title: Youngest Ruler selected - The Star Online
item.description:
Youngest Ruler selected  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: Sultan Muhammad V of Kelantan, who at 47 is the youngest of the Malay Rulers, will be the next Yang di-Pertuan Agong. The British-educated Sultan of Kelantan will be the 15th Yang di-Pertuan Agong since Malaysia's independence. Sultan Muhammad was selected on the final day of the three-day sitting of the Conference of Rulers amid the grand setting of the Istana Negara. The Keeper of the Rulers' Seal Datuk Seri Syed Danial Syed Ahmad said the ascension will be effective on Dec 13 for the next five years. Sultan Muhammad succeeds the 88-year-old Kedah Ruler, Sultan Abdul Halim ...

item.title: Festive unity on show - The Star Online
item.description:
Festive unity on show  The Star Online

AFTER visiting his parents and relatives, Yusmahazlin Mohd Yusof decided to take his wife and son to the state-level Hari Raya open house at Perak Mentri Besar Datuk Seri Dr Zambry Abd Kadir’s official residence in Ipoh on Sunday. While many would have wanted to spend time with their relatives and friends, the 44-year-old Fire and Rescue Department officer said he had attended the open house three years in a row. When asked why, Yusmahazlin just said one word: “Unity.” “It is nice to see people from all races gathering here for one festivity. In recent years, we have seen some tension due t...

item.title: Night ride on eve of National Day - The Star Online
item.description:
Night ride on eve of National Day  The Star Online

ABOUT 3,000 people are expected to take part in this year’s Kayuhan Merdeka 2017 cycling event. Ipoh mayor Datuk Zamri Man said the popular event, at Dataran Ipoh, on the eve of National Day had always attracted a lot of people and he expected another good turnout. The event will be flagged off at 7.45pm. He added that Sultan of Perak Sultan Nazrin Muizzuddin Shah and Perak Mentri Besar Datuk Seri Dr Zambry Abd Kadir were expected to take part in the 11km ride. “We will also get all our city councillors to take part and join in the fun night ride,” he said. Zamri said aside from the partici...

item.title: Ceremony steeped in tradition - The Star Online
item.description:
Ceremony steeped in tradition  The Star Online

TODAY marks an important day in the nation’s history as it is the installation of Sultan Muhammad V as the 15th Yang di-Pertuan Agong. He replaced Tuanku Abdul Halim Mu’adzam Shah, who completed his term on Dec 12 last year. To mark Sultan Muhammad V’s installation as the new King, the Government has declared today as a national holiday. According to Bernama, the Chief Secretary to the Government Tan Sri Ali Hamsa said that Section 8 of the Public Holidays Act 1951 (Act 369) allows the day of the Yang di-Pertuan Agong’s installation to be observed as a public holiday in peninsular Malaysia ...

item.title: Aidilfitri serves to appreciate, respect cultural diversity, says Sultan Nazrin - The Star Online
item.description:
Aidilfitri serves to appreciate, respect cultural diversity, says Sultan Nazrin  The Star Online

IPOH: The spirit of Aidilfitri should serve as a platform to appreciate and respect the diversity existing in the country, by holding open house and welcoming guests from different religions, races and cultures. Sultan of Perak Sultan Nazrin Shah (pix) said the Aidilfitri celebrations should also prove the nature of the Muslim brotherhood and its humaneness. "Radiate brotherhood and humaneness with the dawn of Aidilfitri. "Celebrate Aidilfitri by appreciating the manifestation of divine grace and being guided by the Sunnah of the Prophet. "Visit relatives and friends, in addition to receivi...

item.title: US astronaut to speak at Pangkor Dialogue - The Star Online
item.description:
US astronaut to speak at Pangkor Dialogue  The Star Online

THE woman who inspired the 2013’s sci-fi movie Gravity – Dr Catherine Cady Coleman – will be among the keynote speakers for the fourth edition of the Pangkor Dialogue. The 56-year-old astronaut will be talking about Sustainable and Inclusive Development and her experiences in space during the dialogue, to be held on Sept 10 to 12 at the Amanjaya Convention in Meru. It was reported that Coleman - a veteran of two space shuttle flights and a three-month expedition on board the International Space Station (ISS) - helped the film’s star Sandra Bullock with her role as Dr Ryan Stone. Institut Da...

item.title: Over 5,000 ideas pour in to develop - The Star Online
item.description:
Over 5,000 ideas pour in to develop  The Star Online

AN AMBITIOUS but nevertheless successful endeavour, the Perak Festival of Ideas will be turned into a yearly affair. Buoyed by the positive response for the week-long festival, it was said to have generated about 5,000 ideas from various groups through 70 over programmes. Among the programmes held were seminars, conferences, dialogues, and meetings participated by local and international attendees. A brainchild of Mentri Besar Datuk Seri Dr Zambry Abd Kadir, the festival is aimed at celebrating ideas from all levels of society including the youth and the grassroots. Ideas consisting of a my...

item.title: NEP a magical touch for Malays, Sultan Nazrin says - Malaysia Today
item.description:
NEP a magical touch for Malays, Sultan Nazrin says  Malaysia Today

(Bernama) – The introduction of the New Economic Policy (NEP) in 1971 was a magical touch which radically transformed the image and confidence of the Malays, said the Sultan of Perak Sultan Nazrin Shah. He said the NEP did not just give more opportunities for the Malays to participate in the flow of mainstream development but also encouraged the growth of youths especially from the rural areas, with a strong foundation of race and religion. “The NEP not only benefited individuals and families but also injected a new confidence and pride into the Malays. “Malay youths filled Malay secondary...

item.title: Perak Sultan worried about large-scale corruption in country - The Star Online
item.description:
Perak Sultan worried about large-scale corruption in country  The Star Online

TANJUNG MALIM: Perak Ruler Sultan Nazrin Shah (pic) has expressed his concern over the corruption and criminal breach of trust committed openly by highly-educated and high-ranking individuals. He said based on media reports, corrupt practices and criminal breach of trust were not only rampant but even occurring on a very large scale. Sultan Nazrin said history has shown that criminal breach of trust and corrupt practices, and ravenous use of power were factors that had caused the downfall of many governments and collapse of civilisations. "In the history of Islamic governments, many among t...

item.title: Sultan launches book that analyses global economy - The Star Online
item.description:
Sultan launches book that analyses global economy  The Star Online

SUBANG JAYA: A new book that dissects the global economy and proposes the urgent need for structural reforms was launched by Sultan Nazrin Muizzuddin Shah yesterday. Describing “Turbulence in Trying Times. What Are We To Do?” by former banker and economist Tan Sri Prof Lin See-Yan as a “penetrating economic analysis”, the Perak Ruler said he trusted that the book would be widely read, at the launch in Sunway University here. “If we are to navigate these turbulent times effectively, it is crucial to understand fully the economic dynamics that drive the more visible political developments. “P...

item.title: Cocoa and coconut corporation to replace M’sian Cocoa Board - The Star Online
item.description:
Cocoa and coconut corporation to replace M’sian Cocoa Board  The Star Online

BAGAN DATUK: Malaysia Cocoa and Coconut Corp will be established to replace the Malaysian Cocoa Board in an effort to increase the production of coconuts in the country, said Deputy Prime Minister Datuk Seri Dr Ahmad Zahid Hamidi. He said negotiations had been held with the Plantation Industries and Commodities Minister, Datuk Seri Mah Siew Keong, to include coconut as a commodity and agricultural crop under the Malaysian Cocoa Board (Inc) Act 1988. “The working paper from the said ministry will be presented to the Cabinet to include coconut as a commodity, besides cocoa (in the Act). “Apar...

item.title: KJ: Islamophobia triggered during elections in western countries - Malaysiakini
item.description:
KJ: Islamophobia triggered during elections in western countries  Malaysiakini

Islamophobia is often seen to be triggered whenever an election takes place in western countries, said Youth and Sports Minister Khairy Jamaluddin. He said candidates or political parties contesting in the elections were likely to make Islam a target or campaign asset to win the support of voters. “Hence, the rise of hatred against Islam actually hasn’t subsided years after the Sept 11 incident, and in fact, it has become more extreme,” he said. He was speaking to reporters after delivering a speech titled ‘Young Leadership of Malaysia’ in conjunction with the World Conference on Islamic Th...

item.title: Perak Sultan: Healthcare systems needs to evolve - The Star Online
item.description:
Perak Sultan: Healthcare systems needs to evolve  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: Primary healthcare systems in Malaysia and across the region need to evolve to effectively respond to the growing epidemic of chronic non-communicable diseases (NCDs), said Perak Ruler Sultan Nazrin Muizzuddin Shah. Citing the World Health Organisation, Sultan Nazrin said South-East Asia now has the fastest rising rates of NCDs in the world including heart disease, diabetes, respiratory illnesses and cancers. "In the past, healthcare services in the region were focused mainly on combating infectious and communicable diseases, and on the delivery of basic healthcare services.”...

item.title: Sultan highlights Fire and Rescue team’s dedication and sacrifice during International Firefighters’ Day 2017 - The Star Online
item.description:
Sultan highlights Fire and Rescue team’s dedication and sacrifice during International Firefighters’ Day 2017  The Star Online

ALREADY heroes to many, members of the Fire and Rescue Department made an even bigger impression during a parade held in conjunction with International Firefighters’ Day 2017 on Thursday. To commemorate the day observed around the world, the Fire and Rescue Department brought out their arsenal of equipment, vehicles and personnel for a parade in front of Dewan Bandaraya Ipoh. Themed Bomba Tonggak Penyelamatan Negara (Firemen, the pillars of rescue), the event started off with Sultan of Perak Sultan Nazrin Muizzuddin Shah inspecting a guard of honour. In his speech, Sultan Nazrin spoke about...

item.title: Sultan Nazrin laments over-commercialisation of nature tourism - The Star Online
item.description:
Sultan Nazrin laments over-commercialisation of nature tourism  The Star Online

IPOH: The Sultan of Perak, Sultan Nazrin Muizzuddin Shah, has expressed concern that nature tourism activities are being damaged by over-commercialisation. Citing the example of the state park in Pulau Sembilan, which is famous for the bioluminescent phytoplankton, he said the beauty of the place is under threat by irresponsible operators who fail to respect the rules and restrictions imposed by the authorities. Therefore, he said the state government decided to officially close the island to visitors until stricter rules are drafted to protect the ecosystem and bio-diversity in the area. "...

item.title: Sultan Nazrin urges envoys to engage with civil societies, NGOs - The Star Online
item.description:
Sultan Nazrin urges envoys to engage with civil societies, NGOs  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: Diplomats must work more closely with civil society groups and non-governmental organisations (NGO) to best serve national interests, said Sultan Nazrin Muizzuddin Shah. This is because civil societies and NGOs have emerged as among the most significant players in the international realm today, the Perak Ruler said in a keynote address at the Institute of Diplomacy and Foreign Relations here on Wednesday. Sultan Nazrin said long established and reputable international NGOs such as Amnesty International, CARE International, OXFAM International, Doctors Without Borders and Mercy...

item.title: Ruler: Don’t treat misconduct of Malays lightly - The Star Online
item.description:
Ruler: Don’t treat misconduct of Malays lightly  The Star Online

IPOH: Malays must not take lightly the misconduct of some of those in their community who have shamed their own race, said Perak Ruler Sultan Nazrin Muizzuddin Shah. He also criticised some Malays, who seemed to forget their roots when they started to en­­joy success compared to the advances made by other communities. He likened the attitude to the kind of lifestyle that prevailed during the fall of Malacca to the Portuguese. People had lost out in their haste to pursue wealth and power. “It is feared that the newly-acquired wealth of the Malays will not last long if they relish in lavish s...

item.title: Respect our firefighters, says Perak Sultan - The Star Online
item.description:
Respect our firefighters, says Perak Sultan  The Star Online

IPOH: More should be done to appreciate the efforts of firefighters in Malaysia, said Perak Ruler Sultan Nazrin Muizzuddin Shah. In his royal speech to commemorate World Firefighters' Day 2017 at Ipoh Town Hall, he said it is not enough just to give them medals, certificates, honorary speeches, souvenirs, parades and exhibitions. Instead, Sultan Nazrin suggested that Firefighters' Day be made more meaningful by having spiritual events, which are characterised by knowledge. "Find ways to increase appreciation among the nation and society. "Equip yourselves with programmes that can give meani...

item.title: Sultan Nazrin: Teachers a major force in fight against corruption - The Star Online
item.description:
Sultan Nazrin: Teachers a major force in fight against corruption  The Star Online

KUALA KANGSAR: Six decades of development can be destroyed in just a single decade through wrongdoings that result in wastage, warns Sultan of Perak Sultan Nazrin Muizzuddin Shah. "It is, therefore, a must and even compulsory to build a Malaysian race which has integrity, is honest, trustworthy and transparent not only to keep the weasel away from the chickens but also to ensure there are no chickens that behave like weasels," he said in an emotional tribute to teachers at the Istana Iskandariah here. Sultan Nazrin was speaking during a luncheon with educators held in conjunction with this ...

item.title: Collaboration sees ailing kids and their families visiting movie animation park - The Star Online
item.description:
Collaboration sees ailing kids and their families visiting movie animation park  The Star Online

IT WAS a dream come true for two ailing children, Nur Husna Abiddin, 10, and Nur Arissa Humaira, two, when they got their wish to visit the Movie Animation Park Studios (MAPS) in Ipoh, Perak. The collaboration between MAPS and Children’s Wish Society enabled the two children to enjoy a series of entertainment including state-of-the-art interactive show at BoBoiBoy 4D Adventure, BoBoiBoy Hero Academy, The Smurfs Theatre as well as other shows and performances by MAPS international cast and crew. Nur Husna, who suffers from an inoperable congenital heart disease, is currently under the care o...

item.title: Perak sultan worried about large-scale corruption - Malaysiakini
item.description:
Perak sultan worried about large-scale corruption  Malaysiakini

The sultan of Perak, Sultan Nazrin Shah today expressed his concern over corruption and criminal breach of trust committed openly by highly-educated and high-ranking individuals. He said based on media reports, corrupt practices and criminal breach of trust were not only rampant but even occurring on a very large scale. Sultan Nazrin said history had shown that criminal breach of trust and corrupt practices, and ravenous use of power were factors that had caused the downfall of many governments and collapse of civilisations. "In the history of Islamic governments, many among the leaders of ...

item.title: Perak wants a new airport - The Star Online
item.description:
Perak wants a new airport  The Star Online

AN OFFICIAL proposal to build a new airport in the state is expected to be submitted to the Federal Government soon, Perak Mentri Besar Datuk Seri Dr Zambry Abd Kadir said. Declining to elaborate further on when, Zambry said the state government is now fine-tuning the proposal and will make an announcement once it is ready. “There are still some details needed and we are working closely with the Transport Ministry and the Department of Civil Aviation on the proposal. “As you all know, we have been having a series of discussions (with the Federal Government) to build a new airport,” he told ...

item.title: Royal touch for award-winning Aussie play - The Star Online
item.description:
Royal touch for award-winning Aussie play  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: The award-winning Australian play, Tales of a City by the Sea, kicked off its world tour with a royal touch last night. Sultan of Perak Sultan Nazrin Muizzuddin Shah, his consort Raja Permaisuri Perak Tuanku Zara Salim and mother Raja Permaisuri Tuanku Bainun were among the VIPs who attended the show at Pusat Kreatif Kanak-Kanak Tuanku Bainun here. Written by Palestinian-Australian-Canadian writer Samah Sabawi, the production was brought to life by a multi-cultural and multi-faith team that included artistes from Egypt, Iraq, Iran, Lebanon, Palestine, Malta, Malaysia, Thailand...

item.title: Royal treat for residents - The Star Online
item.description:
Royal treat for residents  The Star Online

RESIDENTS of Rumah Seri Kenangan Ulu Kinta received a pleasant surprise when a member of the Perak royal family joined them for a Chinese New Year gathering at the home recently. Raja Datuk Seri Yong Sofia, the daughter of the late Sultan of Perak Sultan Azlan Shah, said she usually does not deliver speeches, but for the love she has for the home she would do so. She thanked everyone involved in making the event possible and reminded the residents of the home that they are all a family. “We love you, we care for you, and I want all of you to take care of yourselves and be happy. “For the 10...

item.title: Royal recogniton for centre - The Star Online
item.description:
Royal recogniton for centre  The Star Online

FAST becoming a popular education and property hub in the state, Kampar is one of the districts to watch out for in Perak. Previously known as Kinta Selatan, Kampar became the 10th district in the state in 2009 under the late Sultan Azlan Muhibbuddin Shah. Since then, the district has rapidly grown thanks to the emergence of Universiti Tunku Abdul Rahman, housing projects, and tourism. Eight years after the incorporation of the district by Sultan Azlan, his son Sultan Nazrin Muizzuddin Shah visited Kampar to officially launch the Kampar District Council administrative building on Jalan Iska...

item.title: Busy with his new life in Bangkok - The Star Online
item.description:
Busy with his new life in Bangkok  The Star Online

Ex-filmmaker L. Krishnan now oversees the making of his three-storey house there IN ONE chapter from Tan Sri Krishnan Lakshmana’s biography – The Krishnan Odyssey – the father of Malaysian cinema was described as having a rare charm, which not only endeared him to many but made him irresistible to the ladies. His son Prem Krishnan Pasha, who wrote the book, went on to describe how the presence of his father at his parties would be a cause for concern because “the girls I had my eye on, seem to have as much an eye on him.” Now at 94, Krishnan can still recall in great detail how he had used ...

item.title: Zambry: Perak experiencing excellent economic growth - The Star Online
item.description:
Zambry: Perak experiencing excellent economic growth  The Star Online

KUALA KANGSAR: Perak's economy is not on the brink of collapse but experiencing excellent growth, says Mentri Besar Datuk Seri Dr Zambry Abd Kadir. He pointed out that the last three quarters of the year have seen the state administration receive numerous accolades, including having its financial management named as one of the very best in the country. "There are certain voices trying to give the impression that the state's economy will collapse anytime, of which they have not shown any measure of proof. "On the contrary, there are figures to show that the state's economic growth from 2012 ...

item.title: Merdeka Awards honours four - The Star Online
item.description:
Merdeka Awards honours four  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: For their contributions to the community, environment, health and scholarly research, four personalities were singled out at the Merdeka Awards dinner here. The four were honoured for their achievements in their respective fields. Each year, the Merdeka Award is conferred to individuals or organisations in five categories. This year’s recipients are Tan Sri Lakshmanan Krishnan (Education and Community), Tan Sri Dr Salleh Mohd Nor (Environment), Prof Datuk Dr Looi Lai Meng (Health, Science and Technology) and Prof Datuk Dr Wan Ramli Wan Daud (Oustanding Scholastic Achieve­ment)...

item.title: Fundraiser raises RM1.2mil for Rohingya refugees - The Star Online
item.description:
Fundraiser raises RM1.2mil for Rohingya refugees  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: An "Art For Donation" fundraiser for Rohingya refugees has successfully raised RM1.205mil, with Sultan of Perak Sultan Nazrin Muizzuddin Shah being one of the biggest contributors to the cause. The Perak Ruler purchased a painting by artist Latiff Mohidin titled "Exodus", which was specially crafted for the occasion. In his speech at the fundraising dinner held at St Regis here Tuesday, Sultan Nazrin thanked the donors and expressed hope that Malaysians will strive to help those who are less fortunate. “It needs courage for those who are in a position of power – be they diplo...

item.title: Firemen praised for going beyond call of duty - The Star Online
item.description:
Firemen praised for going beyond call of duty  The Star Online

IPOH: The dedication of firefighters in carrying out their duties in Perak has been praised by the state’s ruler, Sultan Nazrin Muizzuddin Shah. In his speech on World Fire­fighters’ Day 2017 at Ipoh Town Hall here yesterday, he said personnel from the Fire and Rescue De­­partment had demonstrated values such as humanity, kindness and the spirit of sacrifice while carrying out their responsibilities. “They are performing their duties without any fear or favour, disregar­ding time, fatigue, heat, dew, rain or sweat. “Let’s hope their life will be blessed thanks to their deeds,” said Sul­­tan...

item.title: Sultan Nazrin: Learn from mistakes of previous government - The Star Online
item.description:
Sultan Nazrin: Learn from mistakes of previous government  The Star Online

KUALA KANGSAR (Bernama): Perak's Sultan Nazrin Shah reminded the new ruling government to learn from the mistakes of the previous administration as the people are ready to reject leaders who abuse their power. He said the people were willing to expose and reject leaders who were using their positions for personal interests, accumulating wealth for family members, or becoming instruments for businessmen. "Learn from the mistakes of previous leaders. The people will be very disappointed if the newly-elected government makes the same mistakes, let alone bigger mistakes," His Majesty said at th...

item.title: Perak MB: Koon not in advisory council due to allegation against late Sultan - The Star Online
item.description:
Perak MB: Koon not in advisory council due to allegation against late Sultan  The Star Online

IPOH: Perak Mentri Besar Ahmad Faizal Azumu (pic) has rebuked prominent businessman Koon Yew Yin for alleging that the Sultan of Perak had interfered with his appointment as a member of the State Economy Advisory Council. Ahmad Faizal denied the allegation, saying that Koon was no longer part of the council for another reason. “As the Mentri Besar, I wished to stress that the Sultan of Perak Sultan Nazrin Muizzuddin Shah has never interfered directly or indirectly on the matter. “The decision not to appoint Koon as one of the council members was my own,” he said in a statement on Friday (No...

item.title: Ruler with the people at heart - The Star Online
item.description:
Ruler with the people at heart  The Star Online

SULTAN of Perak Sultan Nazrin Muizzuddin Shah is well-loved by his subjects. His opinions are widely respected as he is known for his compassion and fairness. Celebrating his 62nd birthday today, the actions and words of the Perak Ruler will always have the people’s wellbeing at heart. During the Conference of Rulers that was held in July, Sultan Nazrin, who is also the Deputy Yang di-Pertuan Agong, had called for efforts to unite the people following an intense 14th General Election. And during the first session of the 14th Perak State Assembly held in August, he told the government to kee...

item.title: Palace denies tycoon’s claim that sultan stopped his appointment as Perak adviser - Malaysia Today
item.description:
Palace denies tycoon’s claim that sultan stopped his appointment as Perak adviser  Malaysia Today

(FMT) – The Perak palace has denied the claim by prominent tycoon Koon Yew Yin that his appointment as the state’s economic adviser was scuttled due to his claims that Datuk titles had been exchanged for money. Koon said after the May 9 general election, the Perak menteri besar’s secretary requested his postal address to send him a letter of appointment as the state economic adviser, but the appointment was stopped on the instruction from the palace. “The Perak sultan has absolutely no right under the Federal Constitution to stop my appointment, and he cannot tell the Perak menteri besar an...

item.title: Sultan Nazrin: Leaders must not betray the people's trust - The Star Online
item.description:
Sultan Nazrin: Leaders must not betray the people's trust  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR (Bernama): Perak's Sultan Nazrin Shah has reminded the country's leaders that they have been entrusted to protect the nation and citizens and as such, they must fulfil this trust. He said the new government formed after the 14th General Election should carry out their responsibilities with honesty and integrity, in line with the move to replace the phrase "Saya yang menurut perintah (I who obey orders)" to "Saya yang menjalankan amanah (I who carry out the trust)" in official government letters. "Religious scholars are convinced that religion will not be upheld, the world will ...

item.title: Perak and Pahang must control farming in Cameron to prevent landslides - The Star Online
item.description:
Perak and Pahang must control farming in Cameron to prevent landslides  The Star Online

IPOH: The Perak and Pahang state governments should stop issuing new permits for agriculture or development in Cameron Highlands to prevent further landslides, says Dr A. Xavier Jayakumar. The Water, Land and Natural Resources Minister said: “I really hope both states will also tighten enforcement on encroachment (into government or forest lands). "Those found guilty of illegal farming must face the music. “We need to use the full power of the law to make sure they stop such illegal activities,” he told reporters after Sultan of Perak Sultan Nazrin Muizzuddin Shah proclaimed Kinta Valley as...

item.title: Sultan Nazrin lists three transitions needed to propel country forward - The Star Online
item.description:
Sultan Nazrin lists three transitions needed to propel country forward  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR (Bernama): Perak's Sultan Nazrin Muizzuddin Shah says there is a need to develop a more open and resilient Malaysian society and economy to move the country forward to the next level and achieve high-income status in line with its potential. He said two other key structural transitions needed to achieve these goals were establishing a truly just and equitable society, and taking full advantage of the current wave of technological transformation. In making the economy and society resilient, competitive and performance-based, he noted that Malaysia was currently the world's 22nd ...

item.title: How a new Agong is elected - The Star Online
item.description:
How a new Agong is elected  The Star Online

UNDER Malaysia’s constitutional monarchy, the Yang di-Pertuan Agong’s position as head of state is not hereditary but one which has to be elected by his peers. And while other monarchies have only the king or queen, our Yang di-Pertuan Agong has a deputy. His Majesty is elected by the Conference of Rulers according to the method and manner prescribed in the Third Schedule of the Constitution, and Regulations of the Conference of Rulers. The Conference is made up of nine Rulers from Johor, Selangor, Negeri Sembilan, Perak, Kedah, Perlis, Pahang, Kelantan and Terengganu, and governors of four...

item.title: Going against the Constitution will bring discord, says Perak Ruler - The Star Online
item.description:
Going against the Constitution will bring discord, says Perak Ruler  The Star Online

IPOH: Any attempt to change the social contract that was jointly agreed during the drafting of the Federal Constitution will only invite discord, says Sultan of Perak Sultan Nazrin Muizzuddin Shah. He said such acts would also threaten political stability and public order. He said though there was a change in government, the basic provisions as enshrined in the Federal Constitution must be protected and not compromised. These, Sultan Nazrin said, included matters related to the Rulers, Islam, the national language, the special status of Malays and bumiputras, including the rights of other r...

item.title: Perak Sultan reminds govt to make good on GE14 promises - The Star Online
item.description:
Perak Sultan reminds govt to make good on GE14 promises  The Star Online

IPOH: Election promises must be kept, Perak Ruler Sultan Nazrin Muizzuddin Shah has told the government. “It has been almost 90 days since the election, with various promises made. “Voters dared to take the risk to change the government as they are confident that a change will bring good to the people and country,” he said in his opening speech of the second meeting of the first session of the 14th Perak State Assembly here yesterday. He also said the majority of the voters chose to change the state government as they wanted good governance. “The government, as consented by me, is to govern...

item.title: Perak Sultan: Growing pains part of Malaysia's path to mature democracy - The Star Online
item.description:
Perak Sultan: Growing pains part of Malaysia's path to mature democracy  The Star Online

IPOH: Sultan of Perak Sultan Nazrin Muizzuddin Shah (pic) said there will be “growing pains” in the journey to make Malaysia a mature democracy capable of joining the rest of the nations already in this “Premier League”. He added that nobody should be left behind in the process, including those with whom we may disagree. “We must avoid the unhealthy practice made in some countries where following an important victory, the winner takes all”. “Everyone under the Malaysian sun should be part of this journey, and we should be mindful to involve all of the nation’s stakeholders in this historic ...

item.title: Perak Ruler says every citizen should be part of shaping nation’s future - The Star Online
item.description:
Perak Ruler says every citizen should be part of shaping nation’s future  The Star Online

SULTAN of Perak Sultan Nazrin Muizzuddin Shah trusts all Malaysians will feel empowered to make their mark and chart the nation’s future. He said citizens of Malaysia, the voters, brought about substantial, even unprecedented political transformation through the ballot box. Sultan Nazrin was referring to the 14th General Election. “Thus, from this defining moment in our country’s relatively young history, I do hope Malaysians will feel empowered and influence the nation’s future. “As I stressed a little over a decade ago, Malaysians of all races, religions and geographic locations need to b...

item.title: Leading minds to attend event - The Star Online
item.description:
Leading minds to attend event  The Star Online

IDEAS shared during the fifth World Conference of Islamic Thought and Civilisation (WCIT) have the potential to be implemented. Universiti Sultan Azlan Shah (USAS) Academic and Student Affairs deputy vice-chancellor Prof Datuk Dr Wan Sabri Wan Yusof said those invited to give their talks at the event will speak on measures that will ensure a harmonious relationship between religions the world. “They will talk according to their experiences. “Their ideas will be practical and not philosophical. “This is in line with the apt event theme of ‘Securing the Future’,” he said. A host of internatio...
